1.text: And Abram goeth up from Egypt (he and his wife, and all that he hath, and Lot with him) towards the south;

2.text: and Abram is exceedingly wealthy in cattle, in silver, and in gold.

3.text: And he goeth on his journeyings from the south, even unto Bethel, unto the place where his tent had been at the commencement, between Bethel and Hai—

4.text: unto the place of the altar which he made there at the first, and there doth Abram preach in the name of Jehovah.

5.text: And also to Lot, who is going with Abram, there hath been sheep and oxen and tents;

6.text: and the land hath not suffered them to dwell together, for their substance hath been much, and they have not been able to dwell together;

7.text: and there is a strife between those feeding Abram’s cattle and those feeding Lot’s cattle; and the Canaanite and the Perizzite are then dwelling in the land.

8.text: And Abram saith unto Lot, ‘Let there not, I pray thee, be strife between me and thee, and between my shepherds and thy shepherds, for we are men—brethren.

9.text: Is not all the land before thee? be parted, I pray thee, from me; if to the left, then I to the right; and if to the right, then I to the left.’

10.text: And Lot lifteth up his eyes, and seeth the whole circuit of the Jordan that it is all a watered country (before Jehovah’s destroying Sodom and Gomorrah, as Jehovah’s garden, as the land of Egypt,) in thy coming toward Zoar,

11.text: and Lot chooseth for himself the whole circuit of the Jordan; and Lot journeyeth from the east, and they are parted—a man from his companion;

12.text: Abram hath dwelt in the land of Canaan, and Lot hath dwelt in the cities of the circuit, and tenteth unto Sodom;

13.text: and the men of Sodom are evil, and sinners before Jehovah exceedingly.

14.text: And Jehovah said unto Abram, after Lot’s being parted from him, ‘Lift up, I pray thee, thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art, northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward;

15.text: for the whole of the land which thou are seeing, to thee I give it, and to thy seed—to the age.

16.text: And I have set thy seed as dust of the earth, so that, if one is able to number the dust of the earth, even thy seed is numbered;

17.text: rise, go up and down through the land, to its length, and to its breadth, for to thee I give it.’

18.text: And Abram tenteth, and cometh, and dwelleth among the oaks of Mamre, which are in Hebron, and buildeth there an altar to Jehovah.
